page.title: 09The Flashes
page.content: In our square there are some{Flashes. When we went to have a look we saw some birds, Lapwing, Heron, Sandpiper, Shelducks and Swans. We saw a Sandmartin fly into a bush,probably a nesting site.There was a lot of crops and there's a railway track that runs through.Subsidence is caused when the brine is pumped out from under the ground.It causes sand and clay to sink in.That's how a{Flash is formed.The flashes were called Sandbach Flashes,Elton Hall and Railway Flashes nature reserve. Cheshire Conservation look after them. The birds are attracted to the{ {Flashes}by marshy ground and shallow water for feeding.There are plenty of small streams and rivers.There are some pipes which could be used for nesting in and a bird reserve.
